title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
I’m a Methodology & Statistics master’s student at Utrecht University with a background in Psychological Methods (BSc, honours, cum laude). I work at the intersection of quantitative methods, reproducible research, and policy-relevant analysis—with particular experience in drug policy and public-facing knowledge products.
I enjoy translating complex topics for non-specialist audiences (e.g., policymakers, busy professionals) while keeping the underlying assumptions and evidence transparent.








NoteContact




Email: timovanommeren@gmail.com
LinkedIn: timo-van-ommeren-b7027314a
GitHub: timovanommeren

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Education
MSc — Methodology and Statistics for the Biomedical, Behavioural and Social Sciences
Utrecht University (UU), Utrecht, Netherlands — 2023–present
BSc — Psychological Methods (honours, cum laude)
University of Amsterdam (UvA), Amsterdam, Netherlands — 2018–2022
Exchange — Philosophy and Statistics
National University of Singapore (NUS), Singapore — (exchange term; add dates)

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Experience

Municipality of Amsterdam — Creator, Digital Reader (Conference: Dealing with Drugs)
Amsterdam, 2023
Co-organised the run-up to Mayor Femke Halsema’s conference “Dealing with Drugs – Cities and the quest for regulation” and created a digital reader aimed at mayors and their staff: a structured, time-efficient entry point into drug regulation topics, with curated links per subtopic (video, news, academic article, report page).

Designed a nested information architecture for fast scanning and deep dives
Coordinated closely with academic and NGO experts (e.g., IDPC, TNI, TDPF)
Contributed to programme discussions and co-wrote supporting materials (script/manifesto)

Reference: Pieter Walinga (Project Manager) — P.Walinga@amsterdam.nl


University of Amsterdam — Junior Researcher & Workshop Organiser (Drug Regulation)
Amsterdam, 2022–2023
Organised an inter- and transdisciplinary workshop at the Institute for Advanced Study (IAS) to help build a platform connecting social scientists, humanities scholars, and civil servants in the Dutch-speaking world.

Literature review + horizon scanning of relevant policy/research developments
Invited speakers and planned preparatory meetings (incl. mayoral representation)
Presented on attitudes toward drug legalisation, including a social-media analysis around public statements by Amsterdam’s mayor

Reference: Prof. Han van der Maas — hanvandermaas@gmai.com


Utrecht University — Assistant, Consortium “AI in Education”
Utrecht, 2023 (short appointment)
Selected to support the organisation of events for the consortium AI in Education (speaker outreach, planning, notes, email coordination). Appointment was brief; I include it to reflect the role and selection context.
Reference: Dr. Gerko Vink — g.vink@uu.nl


Utrecht Social Science Synapse — Co-Founder & Chairman (Study Association)
Utrecht, 2023–2024
Co-founded and led a new study association for research master students at the Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences, with the goal of rebuilding social cohesion and creating interdisciplinary connections.

Secured faculty funding and built relationships across staff/student groups
Led planning and delegation in a voluntary-membership setting
Organised social events and developed an academic network lunch format
Built informal and formal networks quickly across the university



Volt Europa — Data Analyst (Policy Team)
The Hague, 2021–2022
Worked as a data analyst for a young and fast-moving political organisation; responsibilities were fluid.

Analysed survey data for policy development
Supported general team tasks as needed



Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam — Student Assistant (Spatial Economics)
Amsterdam, 2020–2021

Created and edited PowerPoint presentations
Edited research texts
Ran data analyses in R, contributing to a paper in preparation

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:

Statistical modelling, simulation, data analysis
Clear reporting of assumptions, uncertainty, and results



Tools

R (strong), Python (working proficiency)
Experience: SPSS, Excel
Reproducible workflows: Git/GitHub, Quarto/R Markdown (add details you want visible)
Data viz: ggplot2, reporting dashboards (Shiny/shinylive if you want to include)

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
References
Available upon request (or list named references above).






Tip



If you want this CV to also build as a PDF, you can add pdf under format: in the YAML (requires a LaTeX install). For a public site, keeping contact details minimal is usually a good idea.

title: Timo van Ommeren
text:
Hi — I’m Timo
I’m a Methodology & Statistics master’s student at Utrecht University.
This site is my portfolio: selected projects, writing, and a detailed CV.
Currently: writing my thesis at the AI-aided knowledge lab.
